sen.j: 加賀爪 勝之進（かがつめ かつのしん、生年不詳 - 慶応4年3月6日 (旧暦)（1868年3月29日））は新選組平隊士。
sen.e: Katsunoshin KAGATSUME (year of birth unknown - March 29, 1868) was a Hira-taishi (common soldier) of the Shinsengumi (literally, the newly selected corps, referring to a special police force for the Tokugawa regime).

Katsunoshin KAGATSUME (year of birth unknown - March 29, 1868) was a Hira-taishi (common soldier) of the Shinsengumi (literally, the newly selected corps, referring to a special police force for the Tokugawa regime).

Katsunoshin KAGATSUME (year of birth unknown - March 29, 1868) was a Hira-taishi (common soldier) of the Shinsengumi (literally, the newly selected corps, referring to a special police force for the Tokugawa regime).
Katsunoshin was a whilom feudal retainer of Kano Domain in Mino Province.
Katsunoshin was a whilom feudal retainer of Kano Domain in Mino Province.
Katsunoshin was a whilom feudal retainer of Kano Domain in Mino Province.

sen.j: 姓は加々爪、名は勝太郎とも。
sen.e: The family name Kagatsume (which was written as "加賀爪" in Japanese) was also written as "加々爪," and the name Katsunoshin (which was written as "勝之進" in Japanese) was alternatively called Katsutaro (which was written as "勝太郎" in Japanese).

The family name Kagatsume (which was written as "加賀爪" in Japanese) was also written as "加々爪," and the name Katsunoshin (which was written as "勝之進" in Japanese) was alternatively called Katsutaro (which was written as "勝太郎" in Japanese).

The family name Kagatsume (which was written as "加賀爪" in Japanese) was also written as "加々爪," and the name Katsunoshin (which was written as "勝之進" in Japanese) was alternatively called Katsutaro (which was written as "勝太郎" in Japanese).
Katsunoshin joined the Shinsengumi in about 1866.
Katsunoshin joined the Shinsengumi in about 1866.
Katsunoshin joined the Shinsengumi in about 1866.

sen.j: 慶応3年6月10日（1867年7月11日）の幕府召抱えでは平同士として名を連ねる。
sen.e: Katsunoshin's name appeared as a Hira-doshi (common soldier) in a record of the Shinsengumi which was then formally employed as a group of mercenaries by the shogunate on July 11, 1867.
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦日付を補足の上訳出しました。ご確認願います。http://keisan.casio.jp/has10/SpecExec.cgi
sen.e: Katsunoshin's name appeared as a Hira-doshi (common soldier) in a record of the Shinsengumi which was then formally employed as a group of mercenaries by the shogunate on July 11, 1867.
Katsunoshin's name appeared as a Hira-doshi (common soldier) in a record of the Shinsengumi which was then formally employed as a group of mercenaries by the shogunate on July 11, 1867.

sen.j: 慶応4年1月3日（1868年1月27日）の鳥羽・伏見の戦いに参戦。
sen.e: Katsunoshin participated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi on January 27, 1868.
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦日付を補足の上訳出しました。ご確認願います。http://keisan.casio.jp/has11/SpecExec.cgi
sen.e: Katsunoshin participated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi on January 27, 1868.
Katsunoshin participated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi on January 27, 1868.

sen.j: しかし、同年3月6日（1868年3月29日）の甲州勝沼の戦いで被弾、戦死する。
sen.e: However, Katsunoshin was shot dead in the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma on March 29, 1868.
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦日付を補足の上訳出しました。ご確認願います。http://keisan.casio.jp/has12/SpecExec.cgi
sen.e: However, Katsunoshin was shot dead in the Battle of Koshu-Katsunuma on March 29, 1868.
